meanings.sent1: I need to fess up about breaking the vase.
meanings.sent2: She finally decided to fess her mistake to her parents.
meanings.sent3: After much hesitation, he had to fess to eating all the cookies.
meanings.sent4: The guilty look on his face made it clear he needed to fess the truth.
meanings.sent5: Her heart felt lighter after she fessed everything to her best friend.

meanings.sent1: It's important to fess when you're wrong.
meanings.sent2: He had to fess that he forgot to do his homework.
meanings.sent3: She had to fess that she was the one who accidentally spilled the juice.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked him to fess if he copied the answers.
meanings.sent5: He felt relieved after he fessed his fear of the dark to his sister.

meanings.definition: A wide horizontal band across the center of a heraldic shield
meanings.sent1: The golden fess on the shield represented courage.
meanings.sent2: The knight's coat of arms had a red fess running through it.
meanings.sent3: The fess on the shield made it stand out among the others.
meanings.sent4: The intricate design of the fess added elegance to the shield.
meanings.sent5: The fess symbolized strength and unity in the family crest.
